info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:36PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 235 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Windsor, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Valhalla and Rockyhock around 315 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Goose Pond, Whites Crossroads, Merry Hill, Arrowhead Beach, Edenhouse, Mill Crossroads, Trap, Mount Gould, Hancock and Wakelon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
